alert.note: Alert for Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 02 at 2:39PM MDT until April 05 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MONDAY TO 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches expected with locally higher amounts possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph, producing near-blizzard conditions at times. * WHERE...Niobrara County including Lusk. The highest snowfall totals are expected along the Pine Ridge. * WHEN...From 6 AM Monday to 6 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing and drifting snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Conditions may warrant an upgrade to Blizzard Warning with future updates.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
